welcome.title: Welcome to VS Code Setup
welcome.content:
VS Code Installation & Configuration

This guide will walk you through installing Visual Studio Code and setting up your development environment.

We'll cover:

  • Installing VS Code for your operating system
  • Setting up a GitHub account
  • Configuring VS Code with essential extensions
  • Connecting to version control

operating-system.title: Choose Your Operating System
operating-system.content:
Select Your Operating System

Please select your operating system to get the appropriate installation instructions.

install-mac.title: Install VS Code on macOS
install-mac.content:
Installing VS Code on macOS

  1. Download: Go to code.visualstudio.com
  2. Install: Download the .zip file and drag VS Code to your Applications folder
  3. Launch: Open VS Code from Applications or Spotlight search
üí° Tip: You can also install via Homebrew: brew install --cask visual-studio-code

install-windows.title: Install VS Code on Windows
install-windows.content:
Installing VS Code on Windows

  1. Download: Go to code.visualstudio.com
  2. Run installer: Download and run the VSCodeUserSetup.exe file
  3. Follow wizard: Accept the license and choose installation options
  4. Launch: VS Code will start automatically after installation
‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Make sure to check 'Add to PATH' during installation for command line access.

github-setup.title: GitHub Account Setup
github-setup.content:
Set Up Your GitHub Account

If you don't already have a GitHub account, you'll need to create one:

  1. Visit: github.com
  2. Sign up: Click 'Sign up' and follow the registration process
  3. Verify: Verify your email address
  4. Username: Choose a professional username (you'll use this for work)
üìß Action Required: Once you have your GitHub account, you MUST send your GitHub username to your instructors!

extensions.title: Install Essential Extensions
extensions.content:
Install Recommended Extensions

Let's install some essential VS Code extensions to improve your coding experience:

  1. Open Extensions: Click the Extensions icon in the sidebar (or press Ctrl/Cmd+Shift+X)
  2. Install these extensions:
    • GitLens: Enhanced Git capabilities
    • Prettier: Code formatter
    • Live Server: Local development server
    • Bracket Pair Colorizer: Easier bracket matching
  3. Search and install: Type each extension name and click Install

git-config.title: Configure Git
git-config.content:
Configure Git in VS Code

Set up Git with your information:

  1. Open Terminal: In VS Code, go to Terminal ‚Üí New Terminal
  2. Configure your name:
    git config --global user.name "Your Name"
  3. Configure your email:
    git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"
  4. Verify settings:
    git config --list
üìù Note: Use the same email address associated with your GitHub account.
